intro: Arrabidaea barquisimetensis, commonly known as the Barquisimeto arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is typically found in dry forests and savannas, adapting to arid conditions with its deep root system. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or white, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
